comment.body: Disabling JetBrains Resharper makes this plugin work in VS2019

issue.title: Unable to Login through VS2019 Bitbucket extension to local Bitbucket server accepting only https
issue.body:
- Using Visual Studio 2019
-  a self-hosted version of Bitbucket Server (ver Atlassian Bitbucket v6.10.0)  secured with self-signed SSL certificate
-  Server hosted in local Enterprise environment that uses a proxy

When attempting to connect to the Bitbucket server via the extension in VS2019, I receive this error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11597954/73290408-01ee2080-41c4-11ea-869a-be47f055d279.png)

issue.title: BitBucket access permission only Admin
issue.body: Not sure if it's a bug or by design. We would like to use the ext however from BitBucket it's only allowed to be used from users that are set as repository admin. Users that are listed as Write (which almost have the same permission) doesn't work.

comment.body:
Hi,

I did a small investigation for this case and here is what I've found (at least for my case - private repository owned by a team where I am not admin):

Looks like the problem is located here: `PullRequestsClient.cs:252` in method `GetRepositoryUsers`. It is using this API https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/teams/%7Busername%7D/permissions/repositories/%7Brepo_slug%7D which has a limitation: Only users with admin permission for the repository may access this resource.

Due to this in some scenarios like mine it's not possible to use extensions pull request functionality.

Possible fixes would be to replace API call with this call https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/teams/%7Busername%7D/members but it seems it's already deprecated (This operation has been deprecated due to privacy changes.).

Another workaround I've tried was to get a list of all pull requests and filter out all unique authors from there, but this is too time consuming operation. For a repository with 400+ pull requests it took 30+ seconds to receive this list.

One more possible solution would be to remove possibility to filter pull requests by author if you are not an admin and instead provide filtering by some other parameters.

What do you think?

comment.body:
I also get this intermittently. It seems the plugin uses a "lazy" connection to the server, not connecting unless requested. But, it also seems that some operations try to execute when a connection has not yet been established, leading to this error. 
For example, if I try to create a PR, without first ensuring there is a connection, e.g. by going to the "Manage Connections" page, the plugin always crashes with the above message.

comment.body: Thanks Mistykuu. I was able to debug and found required .net framework was not installed on my workstation, after install .net framework 4.7.2 i was able to open Pull Request.

issue.title: BitBucket access permission only Admin
issue.body: Not sure if it's a bug or by design. We would like to use the ext however from BitBucket it's only allowed to be used from users that are set as repository admin. Users that are listed as Write (which almost have the same permission) doesn't work.

comment.body: Private repo. Thanks

issue.title: Empty login screen in VS2019
issue.body:
Just setting up a new dev environment, installed VS Community 2019 (v16.2.5), installed ReSharper (Ultimate 2019.2.2), installed GitHub extension (2.9.1.7781) and Bitbucket extension (1.41.2).

I have seen the exception stacktrace as per issue #97.  I didn't do anything specific to fix it, next time I rebooted I could see the Bitbucket extension and login link as expected.  However after clicking Login I'm presented with a blank window:
![Bitbucket login window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8241300/65105235-9fb43080-da17-11e9-967c-b3b62dc158f8.png)
If I move the mouse cursor around, it changes to indicate that the input fields actually are there, I just can't see them.

I checked log file in `%appdata%\GitClientVSExtension\Logs`, this is the contents:

comment.body: Mahapps causes a lot of issues in this plugin. I'm afraid I'll not be able to help with this, I must have stopped development of this project.

issue.title: Filter Pull requests by reviewer
issue.body: In Team Explorer > Pull Requests, there seems to be no way of seeing only the pull requests where I am either the reviewer or the author. This would be great when you work in a larger team with multiple reviewers.

comment.body: I'm short on time recently, I'll mark it as "enhancement" however I can't promise anything in the nearest future. You can implement it yourself, shouldn't be difficult, I'm happy to approve PR.

issue.title: BitBucket access permission only Admin
issue.body: Not sure if it's a bug or by design. We would like to use the ext however from BitBucket it's only allowed to be used from users that are set as repository admin. Users that are listed as Write (which almost have the same permission) doesn't work.

I'm using [Clear MEF Component Cache](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=MadsKristensen.ClearMEFComponentCache) extension of [Mads Kristensen](https://github.com/madskristensen/), which adds a button under tools-menu to automate the job 1) close visual studio, 2) open explorer to go c:\users.. what was the folder again? and 3) restart visual studio. 
You may need to re-login after clean-up.
@sorryb if you see login popup as as a blue rectangle, try to move your mouse over it, you may can discover username and password text-boxes. which are there but didn't rendered correctly, i presume because of some missing wpf libraries in my gac. this is how I logged in just a few minutes ago. enter key works to submit.

issue.title: Empty login screen in VS2019
issue.body:
Just setting up a new dev environment, installed VS Community 2019 (v16.2.5), installed ReSharper (Ultimate 2019.2.2), installed GitHub extension (2.9.1.7781) and Bitbucket extension (1.41.2).

I have seen the exception stacktrace as per issue #97.  I didn't do anything specific to fix it, next time I rebooted I could see the Bitbucket extension and login link as expected.  However after clicking Login I'm presented with a blank window:
![Bitbucket login window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8241300/65105235-9fb43080-da17-11e9-967c-b3b62dc158f8.png)
If I move the mouse cursor around, it changes to indicate that the input fields actually are there, I just can't see them.

Issue still persists after restart VS or reboot.

I checked log file in `%appdata%\GitClientVSExtension\Logs`, this is the contents:

I tried Disable/Reset/Enable/Reset, but it didn't work for me.  I had to uninstall then reinstall to get it working properly.

issue.title: BitBucket access permission only Admin
issue.body: Not sure if it's a bug or by design. We would like to use the ext however from BitBucket it's only allowed to be used from users that are set as repository admin. Users that are listed as Write (which almost have the same permission) doesn't work.

issue.title: Filter Pull requests by reviewer
issue.body: In Team Explorer > Pull Requests, there seems to be no way of seeing only the pull requests where I am either the reviewer or the author. This would be great when you work in a larger team with multiple reviewers.

issue.title: Empty login screen in VS2019
issue.body:
Just setting up a new dev environment, installed VS Community 2019 (v16.2.5), installed ReSharper (Ultimate 2019.2.2), installed GitHub extension (2.9.1.7781) and Bitbucket extension (1.41.2).

I have seen the exception stacktrace as per issue #97.  I didn't do anything specific to fix it, next time I rebooted I could see the Bitbucket extension and login link as expected.  However after clicking Login I'm presented with a blank window:
![Bitbucket login window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8241300/65105235-9fb43080-da17-11e9-967c-b3b62dc158f8.png)
If I move the mouse cursor around, it changes to indicate that the input fields actually are there, I just can't see them.

Issue still persists after restart VS or reboot.

I checked log file in `%appdata%\GitClientVSExtension\Logs`, this is the contents:

	2019-09-18 12:47:33,354 [1] INFO  GitClientVS.VisualStudio.UI.GitClientVSPackage [(null)] - Initialized GitClientVsPackage Extension

I have also experienced this. What worked for me was:
1. Disable extension - Reset VS
2. Enable extension - Reset VS
